Package dividedAstExport

Class VPDividedExporter

java.lang.Object
dividedAstExport.VPDividedExporter
public class VPDividedExporter extends Object
Divisions specific code in form of ATS into variation points -the negative variation points are annotated with system annotations -the positive variation points are marked with system annotations -user annotations are preserved
Author:
Jakub Perdek

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type

    private RecursionCycleFinder

    Associated instance of functionality to observe and mark recursions - consumes additional resources (not simple)

  • Method Details

    • collectAndProcessAllVariationPoints

      public org.json.simple.JSONArray collectAndProcessAllVariationPoints(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot) throws IOException, InterruptedException, InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException
      Collects, process and returns all variation points - associated information (positive and negative variability)
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      Returns:
      the array of all variation points - associated information (positive and negative variability)
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException

    • getDecoratorArguments

      private org.json.simple.JSONArray getDecoratorArguments(org.json.simple.JSONObject annotationAst)
      Returns JSON array of all decorator arguments
      Parameters:
      annotationAst - - decorator AST from which decorator arguments are extracted
      Returns:
      JSON array of all decorator arguments

      Optionally creates negative variation point representation from decorator/annotation -otherwise returns null
      Parameters:
      annotationAst - - decorator AST from which data about decorator/annotation is optionally extracted
      Returns:
      the representation of negative variation point extracted from decorator
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getVariableStubPart

      private static org.json.simple.JSONObject getVariableStubPart(org.json.simple.JSONObject classMember) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Extracts and returns initialized value from class variable represented in AST object -helps to extract configuration expression (in JSON) from class variable

      Returns:
      class variable initialization (stub part)
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • harvestVariationPointDirectlyInsideClass

      private org.json.simple.JSONObject harvestVariationPointDirectlyInsideClass(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Harvests positive variation point in class - must start with content of VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.MARKER_VP_NAME string
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      Returns:
      harvested system positive variation point from class if found otherwise null
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      text from AST expression

    • harvestVariationPointOutsideFromTheMarker

      private org.json.simple.JSONObject harvestVariationPointOutsideFromTheMarker(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Harvests positive variation point located not directly inside the class - must start with the content of VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.MARKER_VP_NAME string
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      Returns:
      harvested system positive variation point located not directly inside class if found otherwise null
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • getVariabilityDecoratorSelectionsMarkups

      private org.json.simple.JSONArray getVariabilityDecoratorSelectionsMarkups(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Search and optionally returns information about negative variability marker annotations
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST part with object preferably containing decorators/annotations
      Returns:
      the array of information about negative variability marker annotations if found otherwise null
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • isChosenNegativeVariabilityDecorator

      private static boolean isChosenNegativeVariabilityDecorator(org.json.simple.JSONArray usedDecorators)
      Decides if at least one decorator belongs to negative variability
      Parameters:
      usedDecorators - - all associated decorators that annotate particular code fragment
      Returns:
      true if at least one decorator belongs to negative variability otherwise false

    • findExistingVariabilityDecorator

      private org.json.simple.JSONArray findExistingVariabilityDecorator(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Extracts and optionally returns information about negative variability variation point from decorator/annotation
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST part with object preferably containing decorators/annotations
      Returns:
      the information about existing negative variability decorators
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • harvestNewlyAvailableVariationPoint

      private org.json.simple.JSONObject harvestNewlyAvailableVariationPoint(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, String contextStringIdentifier) throws IOException, InterruptedException, InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException
      Harvests and returns information about newly available positive variability variation point
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      contextStringIdentifier - - string with sequence of inner wrapper objects such as classes (in case of class function) and methods
      Returns:
      harvested information about newly available positive variability variation point
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException

    • harvestVariationPoint

      private org.json.simple.JSONObject harvestVariationPoint(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot, org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, String contextStringIdentifier) throws IOException, InterruptedException, InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException
      Checks for negative or for positive variation point and optionally returns associated data - firstly the negative variation point is checked - if negative variation point is found then associated data are returned - secondly the positive variation point is checked - if positive variation point is found then associated data are returned otherwise returns null
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      contextStringIdentifier - - string with sequence of inner wrapper objects such as classes (in case of class function) and methods
      Returns:
      the negative variation point data or positive variation point data if found otherwise null
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException

    • harvestAndClasifyVariationPoint

      private void harvestAndClasifyVariationPoint(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot, org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, String contextStringIdentifier, org.json.simple.JSONArray positiveVariability, org.json.simple.JSONArray negativeVariability) throws IOException, InterruptedException, InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException
      Harvests and classify variation point to negative or positive variability if found -if found the result is harvested and stored to array according to associated variability
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      contextStringIdentifier - - string with sequence of inner wrapper objects such as classes (in case of class function) and methods
      positiveVariability - - the array with information about positive variability variation points
      negativeVariability - - the array with information about negative variability variation points
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException

    • getAffectedCodeFromParent

      private void getAffectedCodeFromParent(org.json.simple.JSONObject harvestedVariationPoint, org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent)
      Extracts affected code according to its boundaries from the AST and associates it with variation point
      Parameters:
      harvestedVariationPoint - - extracted/associated data from particular variation point
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part

    • harvestAlreadyAvailableVariationPoint

      private org.json.simple.JSONObject harvestAlreadyAvailableVariationPoint(org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, String contextStringIdentifier, org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Harvests and returns the information associated with existing negative variability variation point
      Parameters:
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      contextStringIdentifier - - string with sequence of inner wrapper objects such as classes (in case of class function) and methods
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      Returns:
      the harvested information associated with existing negative variability variation point
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • updateContextStringIdentifier

      private String updateContextStringIdentifier(String contextStringIdentifier, org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart)
      Updates context identifier string if inner structure is encountered such as method or class - the dot notation is used for this purpose
      Parameters:
      contextStringIdentifier - - string with sequence of inner wrapper objects such as classes (in case of class function) and methods
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      Returns:
      the optionally updated context identifier string according to encountered inner structures such as methods or classes

    • harvestVariationPoints

      private void harvestVariationPoints(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot, org.json.simple.JSONObject astPart, org.json.simple.JSONObject astParent, String contextStringIdentifier, List<org.json.simple.JSONObject> harvestedVariationPoints) throws IOException, InterruptedException, InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException
      Recursively harvests positive and negative variation points from divisioned AST
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      astPart - - actually processed AST part
      astParent - - the parent of actually processed AST part
      contextStringIdentifier - - string with sequence of inner wrapper objects such as classes (in case of class function) and methods
      harvestedVariationPoints - - the list of representations where each has associated information about positive and negative variability variation points
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
      InvalidSystemVariationPointMarkerException

    • convertRepeatedlyToVerifyPositionNumbering

      private org.json.simple.JSONObject convertRepeatedlyToVerifyPositionNumbering(org.json.simple.JSONObject astRoot) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Repeatedly converts AST to code and back to update AST starting and ending positions
      Parameters:
      astRoot - - the root of processed AST
      Returns:
      the root of AST converted to and back
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
